New Records: The Blue Jays set a new season high in runs
The Blue Jays set a new season high in hits with 23
Key Match Events: José Berríos pitched six scoreless innings
Daulton Varsho, Spencer Horwitz, Addison Barger, and Will Wagner all homered for the Blue Jays
Twins starter Zebby Matthews made just his fourth Major League start and gave up nine runs in two innings
Pre-Game Insights: Blue Jays manager John Schneider mentioned the team's plan to take away the top of the zone from Twins starter Zebby Matthews
Schneider also emphasized the importance of strong execution by the hitting team
Post-Match Reflections: Horwitz said the team's youth made it easier for them to stay locked in and maintain their intensity with a big early lead
Schneider praised the team's hitting plan and the execution of the players
Miscellaneous Highlights: Will Wagner became the first Blue Jays rookie to record a five-hit night
Twins utilityman Kyle Farmer came on to pitch the eighth and ninth innings
The Blue Jays sent 11 men to the plate in the first inning and every starter except George Springer had a hit by the second inning
Others: The game was a 15-0 rout at Target Field, with the Blue Jays setting a record for their largest shutout victory in franchise history
